intro: Actinostemma biglandulosum, commonly known as the large-leaved actinostemma, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features compound leaves with serrated edges and produces small, white to greenish flowers arranged in umbels. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas. Its botanical structure supports its role in local ecosystems, providing habitat and nectar for various pollinators.
